listing.listing_description: Set in a landscape famously dotted with medieval towers, rolling hills and olive groves, this impressive villa offers the complete experience in serene Tuscan countryside. Designed with a touch of farmhouse style, guests will love the huge living space, broad stone terrace and refreshing, lengthy infinity pool, especially a day exploring nearby villages and centuries-old piazzas in nearby Lucca.Built amidst a series of sun-drenched hills, Villa Il Diavoletto is offers a captivating view of active olive plantations and cypress groves, with the brilliant splash of the pool’s blue and the classic white walls of the property helping to make it stand out in the landscape. Guests can begin the day by stepping out through broad double doors to the wonderfully simple alfresco dining area, savoring a rejuvenating coffee and deliciously-fresh local pastry in the streaming sunshine. That same sunshine flows through the windows of the open-plan living area, which nevertheless ensures a shady, cool and welcoming group space, while fantastic meals can be prepared in the fully-equipped kitchen. The massive views offered from the bedrooms are the real feature, with guests able to enjoy the creeping glory of the Italian dawn breaking over the sleeping landscape outside, as songbirds chirp in the fresh morning air. This villa offers the best of countryside peace as well as excellent access to the historic town of Lucca, complete with the very finest dining options and architectural marvels like the oak-topped Guinigi Tower. A local drive will reveal majestic gardens and gorgeously preserved stately homes that seem to be around every corner in this storied region of Italy. Peaceful pools, natural springs and carved statues hide in grottos and waysides across countryside. Just fifteen minutes away is Pinocchio Park in Collodi, celebrating the birthplace of one of children’s fiction’s most beloved figures, complete with sculptures, ornamental ponds and puppet shows, while the historic metropolis of Florence is just an hour’s drive away.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Nestled into the quaint countryside of Chianti, on the outskirts of Florence, this eight bedroom is the perfect host for a family reunion, high-end corporate event, and with its own on-site chapel, Vitigliano is an amazing wedding destination. Complete with its own wellness center, spacious interior and exterior living areas, and multiple dining venues, Vitigliano is among the most exclusive in Tuscany. Located between Florence and Siena, you’ll have no trouble navigating your way around some of Tuscany’s most famous attractions.Vitigliano has all the authentic, elegant charm you’d expect from such a prestigious Tuscan villa. The exposed wood beams, natural stone accents, arched doorways, and brick ceilings show off the villa’s historic side, while designer furniture, high-end electronics, and stylish contemporary design display the luxuries of today. Vitigliano’s eight bedrooms are all outfitted with king-sized beds, en-suite bathrooms, and a separate sitting or living area.The perfect dinner setting awaits in one of four dining areas at villa Vitigliano. Inside, the formal dining area has seating for eighteen. Outside, you’ll find three more alfresco dining areas, all with seating for twenty. The fully equipped kitchen, wine cellar, barbecue, and outdoor kitchenette will make meal prep a breeze. For some fun in the sun, you’ll appreciate the villa’s fenced-in swimming pool, hot tub, alfresco shower, and children’s play area. And inside, you’ll enjoy Wi-Fi, a sound system, fireplace, air conditioning, an exercise room, and more.Just thirty-kilometers from home, you’ll have quick and easy access to Florence, one of Italy’s most important arts and culture hubs. The home of Michelangelo’s David, ancient architecture, World-renowned museums, and Michelin-starred restaurants, Florence is always an exciting place to spend an afternoon, and evening. Closer to home, you’ll find plenty of wine tasting opportunities in Greve, one of Chianti’s many vineyard areas. And, if you’re in the mood to visit the beach, you’ll find pristine white sand, and an almost Caribbean-like atmosphere, just over an hour away on Spiagge Bianche.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: 13th-century architecture and sumptuous marble envelop guests of this palazzo apartment in the shadow of the Scuola Grande di San Marco. From its entrance on a quiet square to its brick-walled private terrace, the villa offers a respite. But the domes of St. Mark’s Basilica and the arches of the Rialto Bridge are a 10-minute walk or less—and you can stop at famed pastry shop Rosa Salva on the way. Pick up a new favorite wine to uncork in the villa courtyard and toast to Italy around the al-fresco dining table. Sip an after-dinner Nespresso while you watch the smart TV or catch up on feeds via Wi-Fi. For your comfort and convenience, the apartment also has air conditioning and laundry facilities. Original details such as beamed ceilings pair with newly installed Carrara marble, travertine, and rare woods for an ambience of thoughtful luxury. Tall windows let light from the piazza wash over cream-colored walls and a silk area rug in the living room. The separate dining room shares space with the fully equipped kitchen and opens to the courtyard. This vacation rental has two bedrooms with queen beds, en-suite bathrooms, and air conditioning. It also has a guest room with a twin bed and air conditioning that has hallway access to one of the en-suite bathrooms, making it ideal for a family on holiday with an older child. Step outside—and look up—to take in the ancient stones of the Basilica Santi Giovanni e Paolo and the marble of the Grande Scuola di San Marco, which is both one of Venice’s hospitals and home to a fascinating little medical museum. Treat yourself to something from nearby Rosa Salva, one of the city’s oldest bakeries, as you stroll to the Rialto Bridge and St. Mark’s Square, or sit down to a honeymoon-worthy dinner at a canalside restaurant in the neighborhood. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: See the ancient beauty of Sicily in an ultra-modern light at Blumarine. With large terraces, spacious grounds and streamlined architecture, this private five-bedroom oceanfront villa is a contemporary oasis on the coast. Its location within walking distance of the beach in the Siracusa area makes it an ideal base for exploring the region’s historic towns.Blumarine opens to a broad lawn and extensive deck with a shaded sitting area, a row of lounge chairs in the sun and an inviting pool. Whether you’ve been for a swim in the pool or the sea, rinse off in the al-fresco shower before stepping into the outdoor kitchen and grilling local seafood on the barbecue. The flavors will only be enhanced by the views from the outdoor dining area. Choose a bottle from the wine cellar and spend the evening watching television or indulging in a session in the sauna or hot tub.The refined interiors of this vacation rental combine beachy comfort with modern luxury. Pale wood floors and white walls are a gallery-like backdrop for pieces like a crisp white sectional, farmhouse-style dining table and chairs and deep blue artwork in the open-plan living and dining room. The adjacent fully equipped eat-in kitchen has its own views of the sea and a dreamy wallpaper that recalls antique painted maps.Five suite-style bedrooms mean Blumarine can accommodate family vacations or intimate honeymoons with ease. There are three bedrooms with double beds, two of which have private balconies, and two bedrooms with two twin beds each. The same light floors and walls as in the main living areas give the bedrooms the same quietly stylish feel, while wallpaper in a bird motif adds a hint of whimsy and color.Start your holiday on Sicily with a flight into Comiso Airport, 57 km from the villa, or Catania Fontanarossa Airport, 121 km away. Once you’re at Blumarine, you’re just a 1-minute walk from Rocky Beach and a 10-minute walk from Sandy Beach. Find amenities like shopping and dining in the nearby town of Pozzallo, 8.5 km away, and plan a day trip to the historic towns of Modica and Ragusa. If it’s just not a vacation without golf, make the 40 km drive to Donnafugata Golf Course for a round or two.Copyright © 2016 Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Take in the timeless silhouette of the Matterhorn from a modern setting at Chalet Aconcagua. Set in the new luxury 7 Heavens development in the heart of Zermatt, this five-bedroom Swiss Alps vacation rental boasts views of the iconic slopes and puts a contemporary spin on classic chalet style. A full staff lets you take advantage of the two ski lifts just a short walk away.Your stay at Chalet Aconcagua includes the services of a chef, host, chalet manager and driver. You’ll enter through the 7 Heavens lobby, where you can leave ski gear in your private ski room, enjoy a cocktail at the bar, sample a cigar in the lounge or stretch out in the shared gym. An elevator whisks you up to the villa, which has its own spa area, indoor hot tub, home theater and wine fridge, and is fully equipped with state-of-the-art audio-visual systems.The chalet’s mix of reclaimed timbers and modern furnishings creates a refined yet warm feel. The top-floor main living area is set under a traditional sloped ceiling and features comfortable sitting and dining areas laid out around a sleek double-sided fireplace and picture windows that frame the mountain views. Though there is a fully equipped open kitchen in one corner of the room for your use, there’s also a separate professional kitchen for the staff.Five bedrooms, each with an en-suite bathroom, provide honeymoon-worthy accommodations for adults and separate, family-friendly spaces that kids will love. There are two bedrooms with king beds that open to balconies, one of which has Matterhorn views, and two bedrooms with double beds that open to balconies, again including one with Matterhorn views. The children’s room has two bunk beds.The Zermatt region is known for its year-round skiing and nearly year-round sunshine, and Chalet Aconcagua puts you in the heart of it all, just steps from the Sunnegga funicular and a 15-minute walk from the Matterhorn Express ski lift. You’ll find shopping and dining in downtown Zermatt, but you can also take a taxi or shuttle to nearby Täsch in about 10 minutes. For avid players or amateurs after stunning scenery, Golf Club Matterhorn is a 8 km drive. At the end of your holiday, plan to fly out of the Malpensa, Zurich or Geneva airport.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Chalet Mckinley conjures feelings of an alpine palace in the heart of Zermatt. Located within the 7 Heavens project—a new complex of seven outstanding chalets just steps from the Zermatt lift—this five-bedroom private residence features extraordinary living areas, an outstanding private spa, and top-shelf luxury services including a chalet manager, chef, and daily housekeeping. With five deluxe bedrooms accommodating ten, your chalet is ideal for large or multiple families seeking a supreme balance of convenience, comfort, and style in the Swiss Alps.On the chalet's top floor, the open-plan Great Room with vaulted wood ceilings combines classic alpine structure with lovely elements of contemporary Swiss design. A double-sided, modernist, wood-burning fireplace warms the space, situated between the ample, sumptuous lounge area and the long, feast-ready dining table. Floor-to-ceiling windows gaze out on stunning views of Zermatt and the Matterhorn, and you can step onto the spacious balcony to savor the fresh mountain air. With a fully equipped kitchen featuring an island wet bar and excellent wine cooler, the Great Room is the perfect setting for festive and relaxing evenings together.Between the first and second floor is the chalet's superb private spa. After spirited adventures on the slopes, relax in the exquisite Hammam, soothe your muscles in the sauna, and treat yourself to a massage. Bathe your body in the hot tub and immerse yourself in the delicious plunge pool. In the morning, work up a sweat in the fitness center before hitting the slopes anew.The chalet features five exquisite bedrooms distributed over three floors. On the first floor are three guestrooms with double beds, while the second floor includes the master suite with king bed as well as the fourth double bedroom. All of the bedrooms feature ensuite bathrooms and private furnished balconies with mountain views. Wood ceilings and walls create a charmingly cozy ambiance. Additionally, there is a set of kid-friendly bunk beds adjacent to the playroom, with access to a separate shower room.Chalet McKinley enjoys perhaps the finest location in Zermatt, literally steps from the central ski lift and Riderweg Slope, as well as the heart of downtown. Golfers will drive just a few minutes to the excellent Golf Club Matterhorn.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Villa Suderi is an old and beautiful colonial era house, located in the Sicilian countryside not far from the impressive Selinunte excavations facing the sea and several delightful beaches. You will be enchanted by the quaint Italian charms of Selinunte. The villa is located only a jaunt away from the beaches of Menfi and to Tre Fontane, so you will be perfectly poised for the ultimate Mediterranean holiday.This villa is surrounded by a wonderful palm tree garden where the infinity swimming pool merges in a brilliant balance with the natural environment. The estate enjoys all around views of the picturesque Mediterranean countryside and offers utmost privacy. Your reservation includes access to a property manager who speaks English and French and will happily attend to all of your questions and requests. Villa Suderi provides all of the modern luxury comforts that make a vacation relaxing and hassle free including a jetted tub, patio, Wi-Fi and DVD player.The property is set in an expansive, fenced estate where olive trees enrich the various pathways. Rustic, yet modern decor adorns the property, and soft leather couches are a pleasure to curl up on while enjoying a fabulous glass of wine in the inviting living area. The kitchen at Villa Suderi is a chef’s dream. Both homey and practical, the fully equipped kitchen features stone walls, gorgeous wooden doors and a dishwasher.Enjoy the master bedroom with a king sized bed, en-suite bathroom and air conditioning. A total of four bedrooms accommodates eight fortunate guests at Villa Suderi in total Italian resplendence. Each bedroom offers a unique set of charms and the ambience acts as lullaby providing soothing nights of sleep.The ruins of Selinunte are some of the most impressive of the Ancient Greek world, and the site is one of the most captivating in Sicily. Selinos (as it was known to the Greeks) was once one of the richest and most powerful cities in the world, with over 100,000 inhabitants and an unrivalled temple-building program. With all sorts of activities at your grasp, you can visit archeological sights, nature reserves, museums, beaches and historical sites during your stay at this spectacular Italian villa.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Villa Ruby is a stunning luxury home on the northeast coast of Mallorca, with sweeping views of the Canyamel Valley. Part of Cap Vermell Estate, an exclusive community of twelve detached villas, the home enjoys a private, 1,830-square-meter estate and a prime location within minutes of the beach and golf course. The beautifully constructed villa balances the rustic charm and craftsmanship of this famed Spanish island with superb modern comforts, including a voluminous private swimming pool (with retractable cover) and a designer kitchen. Additionally, the vacation rental includes discounted access to Cap Vermell Country Club and other communal amenities. Four comfortable bedrooms accommodate seven guests, with additional bedding available upon request.Set amid citrus groves and vine-clad stone walls, the villa's outdoor living areas invite you to savor the open-air pleasures of the Balearic Islands. Plunge into the pool for a soothing swim, sunbathe on the ample tanning shelf, and sip cool drinks in the shade of the veranda. Relish an afternoon meal alfresco, and kindle the veranda's fireplace in the evening, sipping Spanish wine or Mallorcan palo (a traditional local spirit).The luminous interiors feature an open-concept layout around the central floating staircase. Beautifully upholstered sofas face a high-end home entertainment system in the main sitting area, while the hearth-warmed dining room seats eight around a square table of natural wood, illuminated by large lanterns. The kitchen is fully equipped with chef-grade appliances and serves the dining room through a lovely window bar. Smaller sitting areas and dens throughout the home provide quiet havens for private downtime. Comprehensive air conditioning and heating ensure comfort in all seasons.The bedrooms are furnished simply yet comfortably, forming dreamy abodes for afternoon siestas or peaceful nights. Three of the rooms open directly to the ground-level terrace or spacious upper balcony. All four enjoy ensuite bathrooms, three of which include deep soaking tubs and exquisite marble surfaces.Villa Ruby is just a few minutes from the highly regarded Canyamel Golf Course as well as Canyamel Beach, while several of Spain's finest beaches are within easy reach by car. Cap Vermell Country Club offers a wide array of sport and wellness amenities as well as delicious, health-conscious cuisine.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Enjoy both views over the quiet countryside and a location close to the hottest spots on Ibiza at Can Vista Belle. As its name suggests, the panoramas from the multiple terraces at this contemporary vacation rental stretch all the way to the sea. Stay at the villa for a quiet getaway with family, or, if you’re on holiday with friends, make the short drive to the oceanfront clubs and bars at the ever-popular Platja d’en Bossa.Set just off the San Jose road, this luxury villa is tucked away amid private gardens and manicured lawns. Revel in the Mediterranean sunshine from a pool area with plenty of loungers lined up or one of the upper-level terraces, which have sitting and dining areas and a barbecue. If you choose to stay in instead of going out in the evenings, there’s plenty to entertain, from an Apple TV and Wi-Fi to a sound system and a piano.Nearly wall-to-wall glass sliding doors link the terrace to the open-plan great room, which stretches the width of the house and offers equally stunning views. Pared-down furnishings such as a built-in sectional and farmhouse-style table in the sitting and dining areas are contrasted by whimsical oversized artwork. The sleek kitchen is set against one wall and is fully equipped.Each of the four bedrooms at Can Vista Belle has a king bed and a private en-suite bathroom; two of the four also have sea views and terrace access. The suites have the same minimalist modernism as the common living spaces, as well as their own vibrant artwork.While it’s possible to spend your stay savoring the quiet of the villa, it’s also easy to drive to some of Ibiza’s trendiest spots. Take an afternoon or evening to wander the streets of the historic section of Ibiza Town or have a honeymoon-worthy dinner at an up-and-coming restaurant. Or take a day of sand and sea on the popular stretch of Platja de ses Figueretes, followed by an unforgettable night at the beachfront clubs and bars of Platja d’en Bossa.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Est-ce que tu parles francais? The French country house sits among acres of grounds. Mature gardens, weathered statuary, and urns punctuate lilyponds. Acres of park surrounds a heated swimming pool. Tiered seating areas and benches are tucked away under massive shade trees. Bring a journal. All of this will inspire.Newly restored with attention to respectfully modernizing without renovating, the main rooms retain their exquisite old-world feeling. Large living rooms, marble fireplaces, wonderfully tall ceilings, walls of bookcases, hewn stone floors, Interesting windows, and real French door balconies look out over the gardens and grounds. La Bastide de Noble is an authentic French manor house. Double carved wood doors open to a living room with a grand piano. An impeccably manicured lawn surrounds the pool protected with tall pine and shade trees. The tennis court, too, seems to have sprung up from the park surrounded by shade trees. Even the modern kitchen retains the massive old fireplace. One can imagine bustling chefs, cooks, and cooks’ boys stood turning and basting partridges skewered over the fire’s hot flames.Saint-Remy-de-Provence is 10 minutes away. The famous asylum where Van Gogh was institutionalized is here and was the subject of several of his paintings. Walkthrough fields of lavender. Discover wines and visit the vineyards of Saint Remy de Provence. It’s all part of the Alpilles.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Situated outside Sitges in the heart of the Penedes wine region, this majestic villa was built in 1842 as a wine-producing estate. A modern restoration and renovation has created an extraordinary, resort-like destination in one of the most beautiful regions of Catalonia, along Spain's Mediterranean coast. Ideal for special occasions or peaceful escapes, the villa features superb living and dining areas (including an alfresco table for twenty), an outdoor swimming pool and hot tub (both saltwater), sport and entertainment areas, a sauna, a gourmet kitchen, and high-end media amenities. A five-bedroom main house and four-bedroom guesthouse accommodate families and groups up to twenty-four in size.The villa maintains the finest aspects of its antique charm, with ochre-toned facades, beautiful masonry, and exquisite gardens and orange groves. The swimming pool (measuring 15-by-7 meters in area and 0.5–2 meters deep) is set amid lush hedges, and plentiful sun loungers, while the elevated hot tub enjoys breathaking views of the countryside. Next to the hot tub is a lovely, stand-alone cabana with lounge and fireplace. A rustic veranda casts cool shade over the alfresco dining area.The interiors balance high-end contemporary comforts with charming bucolic features, including exposed wood ceiling beams, beautiful antique décor, and original arched threshold between rooms. French doors to the terrace breathe the fragrant air into the home. The kitchen is fully equipped with chef-grade appliances and a large wooden island for preparation and serving. The dining room seats twelve, and can be extended to seat twenty guests.The main house features five king suites. The master suite opens to a private terrace and a large bathroom, with a soaking tub perched beside picture windows overlooking the Catalonian landscape. The guesthouse has four king suites and one suite with two double beds, along with a private lounge and kitchenette. All of the rooms enjoy shared or private terraces and ensuite bathrooms. Four single-size beds are available at extra cost.From the rural seclusion of this vintage masia, you’re within easy reach of the beach and city of Stiges, as well as Terramar Golf Course. Barcelona is about fifty kilometers away.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Nestled on the hillside jungle of Sierra Tramuntana, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, this private luxury villa is the perfect home base for exploring the northern coast of Mallorca. With views overlooking the cove of Deia and the ocean, Ca’n Miquelet boasts some of the best sunsets on the island. And, accommodations for eight, all bedrooms with en-suite bathrooms, make this luxury home ideal for your next unforgettable family vacation.Designed and decorated to honour its natural surroundings, you’ll love Ca’n Miquelet’s vibrant take on traditional Spanish colonial architecture. The blues of the ocean, lush greens of the hillside, and natural textures of stone create a relaxing tropical atmosphere, sure to inspire serenity. The living room is a playful setting, with warm, inviting furniture and plenty of openings to the terrace, you’ll be surrounded by fresh ocean breeze at all times. There are several other quaint little spaces throughout the main living area, perfect for enjoying your morning coffee. The dining room and kitchen are beautifully decorated with an elegant flare. High-end appliances, marble counter tops, and gorgeous cabinetry make the kitchen an exciting place to prepare meals.Inside, the formal dining space has seating for eight. On the terrace, the alfresco dining area resides under the covered portion and has space for eight as well. Beside it, an “L” shaped couch is perfect for relaxing and watching the sun set. Beyond the covered section of the terrace, you’ll find the swimming pool, sun loungers, and several amazing vantage points for enjoying the ocean view.For beach access, Cala de Deia is best for swimming, with clear water and a calm setting, it’s great for first time snorkelers. Port de Soller, also within a few kilometres, is a more popular tourist beach. It’s central location, long sandy stretches, and close proximity to bars and restaurants make it an exciting place to spend an afternoon.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.Tourist Reference Number: VT/103998

listing.listing_description: Stay in the midst of world-class off-piste skiing and slopeside luxury boutiques at No. 5 - Penthouse. Nestled in the heart of Verbier, this charming vacation rental is a private haven in the middle of one of the best resorts in the Swiss Alps. Its four bedrooms can accommodate up to eight friends on a ski getaway or an extended family on a winter holiday.The penthouse is available on a self-catered basis, which includes robes, slippers, toiletries and housekeeping, or a fully catered basis, which includes a champagne reception and the services of a chef, host, driver and housekeeper, and even ski instruction. Guests are welcome to use the chalet’s shared spa, hammam, sauna, fitness center and ski storage, and the villa has its own private balcony and whirlpool.A pitched roof and wood-paneled walls lend classic charm to No. 5 - Penthouse, while a glass wall in the living room showcases views of the mountains. Cozy up to a sleek flat-fronted fireplace or relive the day’s adventures around the dining table in the open-concept great room. While chef service is part of the fully catered package, there’s also a kitchen for self-catering guests.The villa has one master bedroom with a double bed and en-suite bathroom and two bedrooms with two twin beds each, one with an en-suite and one that shares a bathroom. The fourth bedroom has a bunk bed and a shared bathroom, making it perfect for children.With both central Verbier and the Medran lift station just a 2-minute walk from the penthouse, you’re never far from your next ski run. In the evenings, treat yourself to something from the shops in town, sit down to a honeymoon-worthy dinner at an elegant restaurant or have a drink with the jet set in one of the apres-ski spots.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Capture soaring views of Mont Blanc from this contemporary ski lodge between Combloux and Megeve in the French Alps. After a long day on the slopes, warm-up in the indoor hot tub and sauna before joining the group by the fireplace. After dinner, drive 5 minutes into town and check out the bars, nightclubs, and music venues around the resort base.Chalet White Peak’s modern grey/white architecture mixes traditional ski lodge vibes with cutting-edge contemporary design to create an atmosphere perfect for any occasion. Exposed wood and stone deliver the warmth you’d expect from an alpine home, while the state-of-the-art kitchen and contemporary furnishings add excitement to the chalet. You’ll be able to keep up with your fitness routine in the home gym. And, you’ll appreciate the included services like daily housekeeping and champagne reception, as well as a few extra luxurious add-ons like a private chef and butler.Hit the slopes bright and early with a short drive to La Princesse Ski Lift or Megeve Ski Resort. In the warmer months, the Combloux area offers beautiful hiking trails, rock climbing, and challenging cycling routes. If you’re in the mood to shop or check out the latest ski gear, simply wander the cobblestone streets of Megeve Village. And, if you’re craving city life, Chamonix is just 31-kilometers from home. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: With a spa area, home theater and attentive staff, Chalet Perla is more than a luxury ski villa—it feels like your own private resort. This stunning four-level, four-bedroom vacation rental has more than 8,000 square feet of beautifully appointed living space and can easily accommodate up to eight friends or family members. Its incredible location in Cortina offers panoramic mountain views, convenient access to several ski lifts, and shopping, dining, museums and more within a short walk.Your holiday at Chalet Perla includes housekeeping, butler and driver service. The villa’s five-star amenities, from an indoor pool and home theater to a fitness area and games room, will leave you feeling pampered and refreshed. After a day on the slopes, leave gear in the heated ski-storage shed and head straight for the spa and wellness area, which has a sauna, Turkish bath, hot tub and more. If you’ll be entertaining, the sound system, wet bar and wine cellar make it easy.The chalet pairs charming traditional exteriors with comfortable modern interiors. The spacious main living area encourages guests to gather with cozy sitting areas in front of the fireplace, a wet bar and games table tucked into a corner. The room flows into a TV lounge, dramatic formal dining area with a live-edge table and a sleek fully equipped kitchen laid out around a center island.The four bedrooms at Chalet Perla were designed as suites and are luxe enough for a honeymoon, with en-suite bathrooms, jetted tubs, lounge areas and balconies. There are two bedrooms with queen beds, one with a double bed and one master suite with a king bed.A location overlooking the promenade in Cortina means chalet guests are less than a 10-minute walk from three ski lifts, and less than a 10-minute drive from three more. Though the town landed on the map as a winter sports paradise after hosting the Winter Olympics, its history goes back thousands of years—and can be explored at local museums and churches a short walk or drive from Chalet Perla. If you’d like to see more of the Veneto region, spend part of a day visiting the nearby Forte Tre Sassi, a historic fortress tucked into the Alps.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Observe the pale pink stone of this lovely villa and see how it softens more and more as the sunsets. It features a grand view of the sea and the Aeolian Islands. It is located on the Tyrrhenian coast, near the seaside resort of Capo D’Orlando. Sit on the terrace and pool area of this elegant formal villa sharing antipasti and Pinot Grigio with friends, while admiring the compelling sea view.Shiny marble floors, antiques, a sweeping staircase, oriental carpets, large urns, delicate ironwork, and ornate crystal chandeliers create the elegant formal atmosphere of the Estella villa. The terrace has a unique swimming pool with hydromassage and of course, overlooks the sea.The evenings mean entertaining. Candles lit, wines breathing, and the chef is busy in the open kitchen next to the formal dining room. Everyone is dressing before the guests arrive, and aperitifs poured. Restaurants, beaches, tennis courts, cafes are all within 3km. Explore Tindari, one of the last Greek colonies in Sicily. Just east of the point at Capo D’Orlando is Spiaggia San Gregorio, where turquoise water ebbs and flows onto a stunning beach. Best wines and food try Enoteca Collova.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Perched on the scenic hills of Cernobbio, a small commune between Lake Como and the Swiss border, Villa Benedetta offers incredible views of the lake and its surrounding mountains. In just five minutes, you can visit Cernobbio’s breathtaking shoreline and beautiful lakefront promenade. Travel just a little further south, and you’ll find the city of Como and its amazing Renaissance architecture. At Villa Benedetta, you’ll have space for up to fourteen, spread across six bedrooms and a reading room with a day bed.Villa Benedetta features elegant and soothing interiors, decorated with designer furnishings and state of the art appliances. The kitchen is by far the most contemporary part of the villa, with its minimalistic color palette, making use of an all-white aesthetic, with stainless steel accents. In the living room, you’re sure to love gathering around the fireplace, and relaxing on the plush sofa. Outside, ancient stone and lush gardens decorate Benedetta’s beautiful patio. It’s the perfect setting for an alfresco breakfast with someone special.Also on the terrace, you’ll surely appreciate Benedetta’s refreshing swimming pool, and view of the lake. Back inside, you’ll have television and Wi-Fi, should you decide to stay connected. And, there’s a dishwasher, Espresso machine, washer/dryer, and air conditioning as well.Spend each morning exploring the narrow and winding streets of Cernobbio and Como, searching out a new spot for croissants and cappuccinos each day. In the afternoon, head to the lake for windsurfing lesson, it’s the favored watersport among locals. If you’ve still got some energy to burn before dinner, the hills of Lombardy Region are legendary among cyclists, offering challenging climbs and scenic descents at seemingly every turn. For dinner, there’s no shortage of delicious options in the nearby villages, or you could head into the bustling metropolis of Milan, which is just over an hour from home.Green Golf Academy is the onsite golf academy available at the two most prestigious golf courses on Lake Como: Circolo Golf Villa d’Este and Golf Club Menaggio e Cadenabbia.Green Golf Academy is managed by Head pro Alessandro Frigerio and has been established with the aim of meeting every player's need offering all different kind of teaching programs according to every specific level. The Academy has excellent and advanced softwares able to study the video of the swing. Track Man, V1 and Capto are also available in order to improve every player's specific performance.Green Golf Academy offers flexible schedules, single or multiple players lessons, rounds on golf courses, business corporate clinic, lessons for junior players and for all levels of ability.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Cinderella-castle stonework hides contemporary interiors at this restored tower above the bay of Isola Bella. Just as a glass railing fits perfectly between the wall’s crenellations, so do sculptural modern furnishings fit seamlessly into open-concept rooms. Watch the sun sparkle on the sea from this hilltop perch or walk to the beach and a cable car to the old town center of Taormina.Water stretches to the horizon in front of the villa’s sunny terrace—and you can take in the views from a lounger, alfresco sitting and dining areas that can be covered, and a hot tub. There’s also a balcony off the great room that’s an ideal place to sip the day’s first espresso. In the evenings, watch the lights come on in town or tune in to the satellite TV, integrated sound system, and Wi-Fi inside.Step through an arched doorway and into the sleek, utterly chic living spaces of this luxury property. White walls and pearl-toned floors and ceilings are a pared-down backdrop for lilac sofas, wide-legged dining chairs with seating for 4, and a kitchenette anchored by a brass island. Malachite green panels draw the eye up to the mezzanine level—and a spiral staircase leads there.The loft area above the great room has a queen bed and access to a hall bathroom. There’s also a second bedroom with a double bed and private ensuite bathroom. The bedrooms share a simple yet sophisticated design philosophy, with cream-colored walls, charcoal bathroom fixtures and brass accents.Most visitors to Taormina debate whether to stay by the sea or the town center; a holiday at this vacation rental puts you between the beach and the shopping and dining. Though it’s set on the road that runs between, you can walk down to the water or to a cable car that runs to the downtown. Go for a family swim and spot fish in the clear water, explore the town’s ancient Greek theater, or relive your honeymoon over dinner at a restaurant hidden away on a winding street.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Admire the stone towers of nearby San Gimignano from the garden of this private, distinct Tuscany villa. Steeped in rich regional history, the crafted interior features classical sculptures and rich wood surfaces. Outside, a lamplit terrace offers open-air relaxation, while an infinity pool underscores lush countryside views. Medieval ruins, galleries and country restaurants are all nearby.The vineyards and rolling hills of Tuscany surround this tasteful home, which has been constructed with both local style and interior luxury emphasized. Features like the echoing stone staircase, carved wooden tables and golden lamps are gentle notes in an uncluttered, welcoming interior. Pleasant bedrooms are perfected with veiled, 4 poster beds, which promise an unbroken night’s sleep in completely air-conditioned comfort. Experience a refreshing dive into the pool, or a decadent soak in the hot tub after an active day as local meats and produce sizzles on the villa’s barbecue.The rich attractions of Tuscany are on the doorstep of Villa Sara. The town of San Gimignano is visibly close by, offering exceptional examples of medieval architecture, sweeping piazzas and its world-famous stone towers. The ancient stone fountains of the Fonti Medievali are nearby, offering an insight into the storied Lombard history of the region. The distinct traditions of the region is reflected in nearby roadside restaurants, where cured meats and delicate soups abound, as well as local wineries offering the delicate crispness of Vernaccia wine, which is unique to this region.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Taras is an extraordinary villa for twenty-four guests in the Southern Italian region of Puglia (Apulia), near Ostuni. Consisting of a main house, guesthouse, and trullo (a traditional cone-shaped dwelling native to the Itrian Peninsula), the home is nestled on an ample estate amid olive groves and fruit trees with beautiful views of the countryside. Its expansive outdoor areas include three swimming pools and multiple dining areas, while the exquisite interiors blend rustic charm with high-end contemporary comforts.Step into the sparkling water for a refreshing dip in the open air, and bask in the Mediterranean sunlight on elegant loungers. Enjoy breakfast at the table under the portico, and gather for alfresco feasts at the long table table under the pergola. Families will enjoy the wide spaces for exploration and play, and gourmet guests will revel in the bountiful vineyards and orchards. The roof terrace with plunge pool enjoys panoramic views of the Puglian hills.The villa's interiors are at once cool and cozy, with luminous white walls that accentuate the natural light and bucolic beauty of your surroundings. Each unit—the main house, guesthouse, and trullo—features a private cooking and dining area. The largest are in the main house, where the kitchen is fully equipped with high-grade appliances and the dining area features lovely French doors to the gardens.There are seven bedrooms in the main house—four on the ground floor and three on the upper floor—all with ensuite bathrooms. The master bedroom (on the ground floor) enjoys a king bed and a private entrance, while the other bedrooms have queen beds. In the guesthouse, there are three queen rooms with ensuite bathrooms and a king room with access to a private (non-ensuite) bathroom. The superb trullo includes a queen bedroom and ensuite bathroom.From this private estate, you're ideally situated for exploring the riches of Puglia and Itria. The region is famed for its fifty million olive trees and stunning beaches and port cities on the Adriatic and Ionian coasts. The hilltop, white-washed city of Ostuni, with its extraordinary mix of Gothic, Renaissance, and Baroque architecture, is only four kilometers away.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: A holiday in the French Riviera never smelled sweeter than at Mas Peyloubet. Not only is this luxury vacation rental nestled amid lavender, rose bushes, and olive and fruit trees, it’s just outside the town of Grasse, known as the perfume capital of the world. Lush grounds with views over the countryside to the Cote d’Azur and seven suite-style bedrooms are the perfect setting for a quiet family reunion or a private and romantic destination wedding.Approached by a long driveway that winds up the hill, the villa feels like its own little world. Stone walls and hedges open to reveal lush lawns, terraces with inviting sitting areas and pergola-covered rows of lounge chairs. Spend the day taking in the views of the valley from a spot by the saltwater swimming pool, then, as the sun sets, open a bottle of rosé from the outdoor bar and heat up the barbecue in the outdoor kitchen before sitting down to the al-fresco dining area. Serve up friendly competition on the ping-pong table for a lively evening, or flip on the sound system and settle in front of the fireplace for a quieter night in.The main house at Mas Peyloubet dates to the 18th century, and its traditional architecture has real charm and presence. Cheerful coral walls are covered in flowering vines and complementary blue shutters, and the open-air living spaces are defined by stately columns and exposed wooden beams. The interiors are eclectic and comfortable, pairing floral-print sofas with cognac-hued leather chairs. But they’re also practical, featuring a dining area that can seat fourteen and a fully equipped modern kitchen.There are five bedrooms. All but one of houses bedrooms have an en-suite bathroom. Large windows edged by wrought-iron railings flood the bedrooms with light, while soft, neutral bedding and furniture in traditional silhouettes give a country-chic vibe.During your stay, be sure to taste the olive oil pressed from trees on the property, and jams and marmalades made from the figs and oranges grown by the villa. If you’re visiting in the spring or summer, keep an eye out for the sweet-scented jasmine and rose festivals in nearby Grasse, and book some playing time at the golf and tennis clubs a 5-minute drive away. It’s a short drive from the villa to Cannes, where you can watch the city from an oceanfront café or take a honeymoon-style stroll along the Croisette and beaches, and both Antibes and Nice are close enough for a day trip.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Treat yourself to views stretching from the Bay of Palma to the Sierra de Tramuntana at Can Gabrielet. This Mallorca vacation rental makes the most of its stunning location in the town of Sa Coma de Bunyola with gorgeous indoor-outdoor living spaces and an expansive rooftop terrace. Four bedrooms mean you can invite up to eight friends or extended family on a holiday in the sun and scenery.While away lazy days by the saltwater infinity pool or in one of two shaded outdoor living areas. For even better views, follow the steps to the private 1,000-square-foot rooftop terrace, which features a covered dining area for ten and a barbecue. The villa also has its own gym, as well as a sound system and Wi-Fi.Slide open the glass walls in the great room to connect the living area, dining area and fully equipped kitchen to the pool terrace—and better take in the views. Mid-century-inspired furniture and playful accents such as flamingo-print pillows give the open-concept space a feeling of laid-back cool.Can Gabrielet has one master bedroom with a king bed, two bedrooms with queen beds and one bedroom with two twin beds. All four bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms and open to an outdoor space, and several have honeymoon-suite-worthy features such as an exclusive dressing room and a jetted tub.Don’t just admire the landscape during your stay at this luxury property—get out and enjoy it! The villa is just a short drive from the towns of Soller, Valldemossa and Deia, where you’ll find shopping, dining and an inviting beach, and a 15-minute drive from the city of Palma, where you can explore ancient castles, cathedrals, museums and fortresses. For a great day trip, try a drive to the charming seaside village of Portals Nous.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Sea views, modern architecture and a location just a short walk from the beach make Casa Blanca Jondal the ultimate Ibiza vacation rental. While this luxury property is tucked away in a private setting on a quiet hillside, it’s nevertheless only 10 minutes from the popular Tropicana beach and the legendary nightlife of Ibiza Town.Watch the sun glitter on the sea from the villa’s expansive outdoor living areas, which feature an infinity pool, rows of loungers, sitting and dining areas, and a barbecue. Bring the evening’s last glass of wine up to the rooftop terrace to see the stars come out before you head inside to watch TV, put a favorite album on the sound system or share photos of your holiday via Wi-Fi.With its crisp white color scheme, polished floors and row of sliding glass doors to the terrace, the great room of Casa Blanca Jondal is a bright, gallery-like space. Cozy up to the fireplace on the sleek sectional at one end, take a seat on dining chairs with futuristic silhouettes and buttery cognac leather or perch on a matching leather stool at the counter in the fully equipped contemporary kitchen.Four suite-style bedrooms make this luxury property ideal for groups of up to eight friends or extended family. The villa has a master bedroom with a king bed and three bedrooms with double beds; all four have en-suite bathrooms.A short—but steep—walk from the villa will bring you to Cala Jondal, a beach known for its clear waters and laid-back ambience, popular with everyone from families to honeymooners to the jet set. For a taste of the island’s thriving restaurant and bar scene, make the 10-minute drive into Ibiza Town; for even more options, drive a bit farther to vibrant Sant Antoni de Portmany.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: This superb apartment is located in the Campo Marziano neighborhood of Rome, just steps from the designer boutiques of Via Condotti and a short walk to the Spanish Steps. Three ample bedrooms include two spacious and well-equipped suites (ideal for couples), while exquisite living areas include a large terrace with alfresco dining and gorgeous views of the Roman rooftops.The terrace is a rare and delightful amenity for an apartment in the city center. With beautiful terracotta floors in vintage Italian style, the space features an ample lounge area under a wide canopy, accompanied by bistro seating and a dining table overlooking a gorgeous balustrade and panoramic vistas. Arched wood doors join the terrace with the interior, inviting lovely light and refreshing breezes into the home. A salon area with exquisite sofas in retro patterns and tones invites you to digestivi or glasses of wine, while a dining table with six charmingly upholstered seats forms a lovely setting for Italian feasts. The kitchen has a mid-century feel but is fully equipped with contemporary appliances including an espresso machine and dishwasher. Heating, air conditioning, Wi-Fi, and a washer/dryer ensure comfort and convenience in all seasons.Each of the three bedrooms features a queen bed and ensuite bathroom. Two of the rooms are apartment-style suites with kitchenettes and private lounge areas, providing spacious sanctuaries for couples and individuals desiring an extra degree of privacy.From the building's main entrance, the myriad delights of the Eternal City unfurl before you. A casual stroll will take you to the world-renowned designer boutiques of Via Condotti, the elegant avenues of Via del Corso and Via Borgognona, the romantic beauty of the Spanish Steps, and the iconic splendor of the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, and Piazza del Popolo. The world-class art collection and gardens of the Villa Borghese are also within walking distance, while the beaches of Spiaggia Ostia and Guerrino are just thirty kilometers away. Both of the city's airports are within a half-hour.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Donna Cecilia is a luxury villa located in the picturesque Selinute area of Sicily. The villa is situated within an expansive fairy tale estate, adorned with plenty of citrus and olive trees. Donna Cecilia is the perfect example of living in chic Italian style, and experiencing that sweet idleness known as dolce far niente.This beautiful villa is set in an oasis free from atmospheric and noise pollution, so it is ideal for families, as well as sun seekers and nature lovers. The villa is the perfect holiday solution for guests seeking contact with nature in the unspoiled countryside of Sicily, not far from the wonderful Mediterranean Sea. Two porches, one leading to the alfresco dining and barbeque area and one to the socializing area, face out to the meadow, interrupted only by the blue of the swimming pool surrounded by characteristic dry-stone walls. Indoors, you will find a television, Wi-Fi access, air conditioning and heating.On crossing the entrance, you will discover a welcoming living room, decorated with elegant touches of old wood. The large windows allow you to admire the delightful garden outside. A comfortable, fully equipped kitchen illuminated by a large full-length window completes the villa.The three bedrooms at Donna Cecilia, each with an en-suite bathroom, are on the same level as the living room. All of the pristine suites offer double beds and easy access to the exteriors. Donna Cecilia can accommodate up to six fortunate guests.Donna Cecilia villa is nestled in a unique setting, surrounded by natural reserves of rare beauty, archaeological sites, places of great historical significance with monuments and churches. This destination is ideal for those who want to enjoy fascinating places in addition to the peace of the beaches and the beauty of the sea. But not to be forgotten are the unique cultural and gastronomic traditions, such as the historic cellars and oil mills where you can taste world famous Sicilian delicacies. Your dream villa awaits!Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: This stunning Tuscan villa is situated in a hilly region known as the Montagnola Senese, just west of Siena. A remodeled antique "limonaia," or citrus conservatory, the villa is part of Castello di Celsa, a restored castle that has been owned by the same family for four centuries. This unique estate also includes the gorgeous sixteenth-century Peruzzi Chapel, as well as a large restored barn for special events. Nestled within this extraordinary setting, the Limonaia is superbly appointed for a memorable getaway, including a private swimming pool and tennis court, beautiful living and dining areas, and a gourmet kitchen. Five bedrooms can accommodate families, destination wedding guests, and groups of friends up to ten in size.The expansive estate invites you to relish the open-air pleasures of the Tuscan countryside. Play games of tennis under the crystalline sky, and refresh yourself in the sparkling pool. Bask in the sunlight on poolside lounge chairs, and savor alfresco meals beneath the flower-clad pergola. Wander the fabulous gardens in the afternoon, and sip local wines in the outdoor lounge at sunset, admiring the sweeping views of the Sienese hills.The interiors exude a vintage Tuscan elegance, enhanced by high-end contemporary features. Ample windows and an arched doorway infuse the living rooms with natural light and summer breezes, while fresh white walls accentuate the rustic wood ceiling beams and gorgeous paintings. The kitchen is a gourmet's dream, with generous prep space, lovely artisanal details, and chef-grade appliances. An adjoining breakfast nook features dual tables and banquettes flanking a set of french doors to the gardens.The bedrooms are furnished with an elegant simplicity, with pale-toned walls complementing the rich pigments of the fabrics and artwork. Each room has its own unique character and charm, with deft touches of exquisite artistry. There are three rooms with king beds and ensuite bathrooms, one room with a pair of twin beds, and one room with a single bed. Air conditioning ensures comfort in the warmer months.Beyond the private paradise of Castello di Celsa, you're just seventeen kilometers from the artistic and culinary treasures of Siena town, and within comfortable driving distance of San Gimignano.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Set in pastoral hills south of Lucca, this stylishly-designed villa offers charming themes and distinct character. Ringed by trees, the home’s lawns sweep down to the contemplative pool and recliner seats. Inside, liberal use of colored glass, fine art and designer furniture creates a cultured atmosphere, while countryside restaurants, Lucca’s ancient walls and famous Pisa are a short drive away.A marriage of stimulating art and premium minimalism, Villa Glam offers all the traditional pleasures of a countryside villa but with a dose of chic fashion. Outside, stroll the circular courtyard or follow the inventive flagstones that mark pathways through the garden, before indulging in a swim in the sun-drenched pool. The grand central interior is ideal for group socializing and indulgent afternoons spent playing pool, relaxing on the easy couches, or whipping up meals in the fully-equipped kitchen. Slats of light creep through the terrace covering, where guests can choose the best spot for reading or relaxing with a tablet, with the garden hammock a much-loved feature.A countryside villa that is removed from tourist bustle, Villa Glam nevertheless provides great access to some of the most heralded sites in all of Italy. The crumbling ancient walls, stone towers and jaw-dropping piazzas of Lucca are just a short drive away, while the sights and sounds of famous Pisa are only just a little further away. The serene beaches and charming cafes of Forte dei Marmi are also conveniently close by. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Sunny and secluded, Casa Hermosa is the perfect vacation destination for a multi-family vacation, especially if you’re traveling with kids. Located on a property decorated with lush greenery, gardens, and palm trees, this beautiful three bedroom is just outside of Sant Antoni de Portmany, Ibiza Town, and San Rafael, all within ten kilometers. With such proximity, the island of Ibiza is yours to discover on your next incredible Luxury Retreats vacation.Casa Hermosa is decorated in a soothing mix of white, terracotta, and wood tones. The living areas are open concept, with large doorways to the terrace, giving the whole villa an airy, natural feeling. High-end electronics and designer furniture decorate the common areas. And, outside, you’ll love spending lazy afternoons stretched out in the sun beds on the terrace.The perfect host for family friends, Casa Hermosa, is equipped with a full kitchen, formal and alfresco dining for ten, and plenty of parking within its gated property. After dinner, enjoy an exciting night lounging by the pool while the kids play on a wide variety of sports, game, and playground equipment, or settle down inside for a movie at the home theatre. When it’s time for bed, each suite is outfitted with a king sized bed and en-suite bathroom. The two master bedrooms come with privy entrances, and kitchenettes as well.Ibiza is well known for its vibrant nightlife, which consists of beachfront dance parties, a wide range of bars, and some of the best nightclubs on the planet. Ibiza Town and Sant Antoni de Portmany have a friendly rivalry over which city has the better nightlife scene, but both are incredible. If you’d prefer something a little more low-key, Old Town Ibiza is where you’ll find the finest dining, set in fourteenth-century architecture. And, you’ll probably want to check out a beach or two while you’re in Ibiza. The closest is Playa d’en Bossa, which is eleven kilometers from home. After that, you’ll find Cala Conta, Cala Tarida, and Cala Jondal, all around eighteen kilometers from Casa Hermosa.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: This spectacular penthouse is the finest private apartment within The Christiana, a high-end complex of luxury residences in the heart of Zermatt, Switzerland. The two-floor, 537-square-meter gem features ample living spaces, fabulous amenities including a sauna and cinema room, and seven superb bedroom suites accommodating fourteen guests. The Christiania's ideal location places you within 500 meters of the base of Matterhorn Glacier Paradise, while some of the finest dining, shopping, and nightlife in the Swiss Alps surround you. The vacation rental's "Fully Catered" option includes chef services, a driver, and pre-dinner canapés, among other deluxe features and services.The spectacular apartment features peaked wooden ceilings enclosing a wonderfully expansive, open-concept living area, the design and décor evoking a lovely balance of contemporary European elegance and classic chalet charm. Kindle a fire in the wood-burning fireplace in the evening, and enjoy your canapés and champagne in the large and sumptuous lounge. Step onto the terrace and savor the delicious mountain air and views of the Matterhorn. Relish an unforgettable feast with family and friends around the long dining table for eighteen, accompanied by bottles from the wine fridge. At night, gather in the cozy cinema room with plush sectional and large TV for your favorite films. And in the morning, refresh yourself in your private sauna, or enjoy a workout in the Christiania's gym for guests.The penthouse features seven bedrooms, all with double beds that can be converted into two twins. Six of the seven bedrooms open to the terrace, four have private lounge areas, and all have TVs and safes. The ample master suite has a walk-in closet, lounge area with fireplace, terrace with mountain views, and ensuite bathroom with stand-alone shower and tub.From the Christiania, you're an easy walk to the base of Matterhorn Glacier Paradise, renowned for its sublime views of the highest peaks in the Alps, including the Matterhorn and Mont Blanc. From its top cable car station—the highest in Europe—you'll enjoy year-round access to Theodul Glacier. The Christiania is also an easy walk to Klein Matterhorn and Sunnega lift stations, and features a large ski room on its ground floor, allowing for an easy transition at the start and end of your day.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Step into the sun-drenched landscape of Provence with this wonderfully-restored country home. The impressive stone-facade house embodies the rich rural heritage of the region, while modern interiors, amenities and rustic touches equal the best vacation living. Relax by the pool, lawns and towering cypress trees, with airy mountains and the medieval city of Aix-en-Provence just a short drive away.From the pleasantly cool bedrooms in the upper loft section of the farmhouse, descend from a sound night’s sleep via a charming spiral staircase to access the expansive kitchen, where an impressive fireplace casts an air of authority and protective warmth. Break your fast with bakery-fresh bread and sharply delicious coffee or juice at the shaded outdoor-dining table. Here, the courtyard walls reflect the early morning sunlight, and contrast with the vivid green lawns that stretch beyond. Revel in the pure serenity of the surroundings, with the echoing cobble-stoned yard and lengthy pathways crying out for strolls, amongst the birdsong and soft breezes of the countryside.Provence is a renowned region of France, and guests can indulge in its fruits at will from this villa. A range of excellent wineries are within minutes of the location, while the charming small town of Saint-Cannat is less than 10 minutes drive away, where herbed cheeses, sausages, tapenades and other delicacies await. Venture into the Luberon mountains to the north and experience world-class hiking and hill-walking, spotting soaring eagles and herds of goats amongst the rugged peaks and hilltop villages. The city of Aix-en-Provence is just 20 minutes away, with a plethora of restaurants offering unique and colorful Provence dishes amongst ancient streets. Finally, return to the golden hour at the house, and taste a glass of local red either in the airy courtyard or the centrally air-conditioned comfort of the sumptuous dining room. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Slip into this peaceful abode in the heart of Venice’s historic core. Charmingly outfitted, the bespoke interior design, comfortable and welcoming furniture and spacious bedrooms all contribute to a sense of calm sanctuary in the heart of this bustling city. With a central location to die for, the likes of the Gallerie dell'Accademia and St. Mark's Basilica are close, with the canal also nearby.Entering through the doors of this pleasant and central apartment, guests can instantly sense the care that’s been taken in outfitting this property. Rich greens, whites and blues dominate the setting, referencing the water and banks of the lagoon that typify Venice’s waterfronts. A reassuring green touch of vegetation and house plants runs through the property, adding a dose of color to the premium bathrooms and spacious dining area. The inventive kitchen, based around a dynamic, stone-topped counter, is ideal for enjoying wholesome meals with fresh Italian ingredients, while relaxing in front of the decorative fireplace is made all the more pleasant thanks to welcoming couches and stimulating art pieces that are dotted around this bright apartment.You can step out into a world of culture and rich Venetian heritage from the steps of this apartment, with the lanes of the city echoing with promise and activity. From Casa Flora, guests can take a walk in any direction and find culture beyond compare. The statue-topped arches and triumphant pillars of the Scuola Grande di San Marco, and the glorious ballrooms and waterfront colonnades of the Palazzo Ducale amongst the many local sights. Just a short walk brings a huge range of culinary options, from classic Italian fare of the highest calibre, to refreshing gelato and coffee in the best Latin traditions. Tired out after a packed day, the entertainment system and delightful couches and easy chairs of the apartment make for a pleasant end to your day. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Experience an exciting blend of eye-catching Venice street views and luxurious interiors at this conveniently-located apartment. Offering everything guests could want from a city apartment, from spacious, well-furnished bedrooms and bathrooms, to plush living spaces, this is the ideal choice for sight-seeing stay in the City of Bridges, with major attractions and fine dining a short walk away.A blend of light colors and exposed white rafters typify this home, amplifying light and ensure a bright and attractive environment. Decadently outfitted in rich Italian furnishings and crafted furniture, guests can relax in style in the living space after a long day spent exploring the cultural riches of the city. Begin the day by sipping coffee and taking in the bird’s-eye view of the flag-decked square below, and end it after a day walking the city’s echoing laneways by climbing into a welcoming double bed, or freshening up at the marble-topped counters of the huge bathroomsFrom this apartment, guests can easily experience the sights and sounds of this canal city. Take a short walk to the waterfront and catch a water taxi, taking in the gliding gondolas and arched bridges of the old town. Just a short walk away are sights like the Scuola Grande di San Marco, a fantastic example of classical Italian architecture, replete with stone arches and imposing statues. The gastronomic specialties of the city, like local bigołi in salsa or tasty nougat bars, are on your doorstep and waiting to be tasted.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Make your trip to the Amalfi Coast truly a stay on the coast at Amalfi Horizon. True to its name, the four-bedroom villa is set on a cliff near Sorrento, where there’s nothing between you and stunning views of sea and sky. You’ll want to take in the panorama from every level of the house, garden and terraces, but be sure to make time for the short jaunt to Sorrento or the beach during your stay.Once you pass through the gates of Amalfi Horizon and continue through the house, the sunny terrace overlooking the ocean is irresistible. A retractable awning means you can dine al-fresco in sun or shade, and there’s a covered sitting area for napping or reading. Just beyond the terrace is the infinity pool, terrace with chaise longues, and steps down to a series of terraces closer to the water. There’s also a hot tub, outdoor shower, small gym area and a barbecue. Inside, the house has Wi-Fi, a television and DVD player and both air conditioning and a fireplace.The villa’s interiors are traditional and cozy, with welcoming wood floors and soothing white walls. Blue sofas and seashell artwork are nods to the ocean in the living room, while a corner fireplace makes the room inviting year-round. The adjacent dining area seats eight around a classic wooden table, while a gold-edged mirror is a touch of glam. A charming eat-in kitchen has a cheerful tile backsplash and beautiful stone counters and is fully equipped.Amalfi Horizon has two bedrooms on its ground floor and two bedrooms on its lower level, all of which have air conditioning and televisions. On the ground floor, there’s one bedroom with a double bed, terrace access and ocean view and one bedroom with two twin beds, which can be combined to form a king. These two bedrooms share a bathroom. On the lower level, each of the two bedrooms has a queen bed, en-suite bathroom and access to the terrace.As its name implies, Amalfi Horizon is in the center of the sights of the Amalfi coast. From the villa, it’s 7 km to Sorrento, 4 km to Leonelli Beach, 9 km to Positano, 17 km to Praiano and 30 km to Amalfi. If you’re arriving or departing by air, the most convenient airport is in Naples, 50 km away.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Play is at the heart of this traditional-turned-chic Ibiza villa, whether it’s a bicycle whimsically hung on the wall of the dining room or a tennis court with room for five-a-side soccer, too. Nearly 5,000 square feet of outdoor living space, spread across an acre of private grounds, make it easy to get some sunshine. In 10 minutes, you can be sampling cheeses at the market in Ibiza’s Old Town. In addition to the tennis court, the grounds feature a swimming pool, a terrace with plenty of loungers, and a shaded al-fresco dining area with a barbecue. After the last volley or cannonball of the evening, head inside to watch cable TV, share holiday photos via Wi-Fi, or, on cooler evenings, cozy up to the fireplace. Step through huge sliding glass doors from the terrace into the living room, dining room, and fully equipped kitchen, whose beamed ceilings and wood-fronted cabinets both nod to traditional island homes and create a visual link between the spaces. An eclectic mix of artwork, including that suspended bicycle, adds personality, while details such as built-in shelving show a practical side. There are three bedrooms with queen beds in the main house at this vacation rental: one with an en-suite bathroom, and two that share a hall bathroom. There’s also one bedroom in a garden cottage which, with its king bed, en-suite bathroom, and kitchenette, is perfect for couples seeking honeymoon-style privacy. This luxury property is a 10-minute drive from Ibiza, where you can browse shops hidden away on medieval streets, sightsee along the 16th-century walls as a family, sit down for an afternoon refreshment at a café, or dance the night away at a club. It’s also close to the Sant Josep de sa Talaia area, which has both quieter fishing villages and nightlife to experience. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Sit for breakfast on the balcony while gazing upon the ancient buildings of Venice that line the San Polo Canal. Watch the canal fill with life as you finish off your Nespresso. Organize a group meeting in the communal garden and decide upon the day’s sightseeing plan. Or just hit the streets and wander. Basilica di Frari, Rialto Bridge, and Scuola Grande di San Rocco are within 10 minutes. Stop back in for a quick lunch at Zenzero. The contemporary kitchen has everything you’ll need to craft memorable meals, maybe even try your hand at traditional Venetian cuisine. Rather keep it casual? Fire up the barbeque in the communal kitchen and grill up fresh seafood from Rialto Market. Back inside, the dining table beneath the chandelier is the perfect place for a special announcement. When your feet are tired from exploring, find something fun on the Smart TV and stretch out on the sofa while the kids play in the garden. Keep up with work or send holiday pictures to friends with Wi-Fi. Or turn on the integrated sound system, take a glass of wine to the balcony, and catch up on some reading while you listen to the sounds of the bustling canal below. After a day on Lido di Venezia beach, head to Antico Martini for dinner, where fresh seafood and produce from Rialto Market are always on the menu. It’s right down the street from Teatro La Fenice, making it an easy stop before a night of Venetian theatre. Eating vegetarian? La Zucca is Venice’s best. For late-night cocktails, hit Harry’s Bar. It’s the birthplace of the Bellini. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Nestled into the heart of Rome, this luxurious two-bedroom apartment enjoys a prestigious location, just steps away from some of the Eternal City’s most coveted monuments. Piazza di Spagna 90 is a gorgeous apartment, perfect for a family vacation or romantic honeymoon, with an incredible view of the Spanish Steps. Each bedroom features a king or queen sized bed and an en-suite or private bathroom, equipped with a jetted-tub and hydromassage shower.This elegant apartment is decorated with designer furnishings, high-end electronics, and a collection of contemporary art. The cream walls and medium-wood flooring create a soothing warmth, perfect for rest and relaxation, yet formal enough to celebrate the most important occasions. The living room and master bedroom both have scenic views of the Spanish Steps and plaza below, as well as plush furniture to melt into after an exciting day wandering the ancient streets of Rome.Piazza di Spagna 90 comes with a fully-equipped kitchen, Espresso machine, and a formal dining area with seating for four. The apartment is outfitted with air conditioning, Wi-Fi, television. The villa also includes a complimentary buffet breakfast during your stay.Make sure to have a camera on you at all times, especially when wandering the streets surrounding the villa, as you’ll find Piazza del Popolo, Fontana di Trevi, Via Del Corso, and the Pantheon, within a fifteen-minute walk of home. Some of Rome’s other “must-see” attractions are Castel Sant’Angelo, Campo De’Fiori, The Colosseum, and the Roman Forum, all of which are accessible in a fifteen-minute drive. If you’re in the mood to shop, Via Condotti, a two-minute walk from home, is an amazing shopping area, lined with some of the most exclusive fashion houses in the World. And, when you’re hungry, you’ll find incredible Italian restaurants on every corner, but a great place to start is Il Palazzetto; it’s very close to home and has a beautiful patio and view of the Spanish Steps.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Find yourself at home in the rolling hills of Tuscany at Villa Lunablu. Parts of this luxury vacation rental near Montepulciano were first built in the 16th century, followed by updates in the 18th century, and the property still looks out over the timeless landscape from the Val de Chiana to Monte Cetona. Use the spacious private grounds and garden and five bedrooms as the setting for a quiet family reunion or an intimate destination wedding, or simply as a base to explore the region’s historic sites and world-famous vineyards.Set at the end of a winding gravel road, the villa is surrounded by olive groves and gardens with mature cypress and pine trees. Its multiple levels open to three terraces that follow the gentle slope of the hillside location and feature al-fresco sitting and dining areas, as well as barbecues where you can prepare meals to enjoy outside. A path leads down to the pool area, where you’ll find an infinity pool, a deck with loungers, an outdoor shower and a bar, and a bocce court.Though the traditional tiled roof, stone walls and shuttered windows of Villa Lunablu speak to the home’s history, the lovingly updated interiors ensure that guests with twenty-first-century expectations will stay in comfort. Cotto floors and brick-clad archways invite you to wander from the casual sitting room to the farmhouse-inspired table and chairs in the dining room. Two kitchens—one professional, one fully equipped and eat-in—make it easy to prepare and serve local specialties or family favorites.Each of the villa’s five bedrooms has a double bed. Two have en-suite bathrooms, two share a bathroom, and one has access to a shared hall bathroom. Details like vaulted and beamed ceilings, exposed stone walls and antique fireplace surrounds ground the bedrooms’ decor in centuries of Italian style, while large windows opening to the countryside are a constant reminder of the beautiful surroundings.Whether you’re on holiday with family, enjoying an escape with friends, or on honeymoon, there’s plenty to do near Villa Lunablu. Make the 15-minute drive to the town of Cetona for a look at prehistoric and Bronze Age archaeological finds from the area, the 15-minute drive to the newer village of Piazze, or the 35-minute drive to stroll the picturesque, car-free streets of the hill town of Montepulciano. Tennis courts and a golf course are also within easy reach, and as you pass through the countryside, be sure to stop off at local producers and sample the region’s famous wines, olive oils, cheeses and honey.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Find welcoming space and Portuguese charm in a coveted private location at Villa Camilla (M59). This Algarve vacation rental feels secluded, but is within walking distance of the restaurants, fitness center and the beach at Pine Cliffs, a Luxury Collection Resort. Five bedrooms and nearly 3,500 square feet of living space mean you can invite up to ten friends or extended family to enjoy the sunshine.Spend blissfully lazy days reading in the loungers on the terrace and cooling off in the swimming pool, then preparing meals on the barbecue to savor at the shaded al-fresco dining area. To unwind before bedtime, watch TV or share photos of your holiday via Wi-Fi. For your comfort and convenience, the villa also has air conditioning and laundry facilities.The villa’s traditional charm—stucco walls, tiled roof—is matched on the inside by details like beamed ceilings and stately columns. Fold-away glass doors lead from the terrace to an airy living room laid out around a fireplace that branches off into a second sitting room and the dining room. The kitchen, just past the dining room, is fully equipped and has a breakfast bar.Villa Camilla has three bedrooms with queen beds and en-suite bathrooms. Its other two bedrooms have a king bed and two twin beds, respectively, and share access to a hall bathroom, making them ideal for parents traveling with older children.It would be easy to spend your stay hiding away at the villa. But it’s well worth the 2-minute walk to Praia da Falésia, a beach that’s characteristic of the central Algarve with its towering cliffs and golden sand. Let kids splash in the water while you stroll honeymoon style on the sand. For a great day trip, see both history and beaches in Faro, wander around the fortifications of Silves Castle or try to hit all the beaches in Lagos.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.
