listing.listing_description: Uncover modern luxury close to the historic charm of San Gimignano at Villa Iris. This beautifully restored vacation rental overlooks the town’s famous towers from a perch amid the vineyards and is close enough to Siena and Florence for a day trip. Make the six-bedroom villa your home for a relaxing holiday with family or a base for exploring Tuscany with friends.Villa Iris sits on more than an acre of private grounds surrounded by quintessential Italian countryside: olive groves, vineyards and hills rolling into the distance. Enjoy the views from outdoor living areas with a stone swimming pool, jetted tub, bocce court, lounging and dining areas, and a barbecue. Inside, you’ll find amenities from a fitness room and ping-pong table to a wellness area with a sauna.The villa itself was once a brick workshop and dates back to 1737. Thanks to a careful restoration, it’s now comfortable and chic, with traditional details like cotto floors and beamed ceilings set off by casual modern furnishings in the living and dining rooms. The fully equipped kitchen expertly pairs rustic cabinetry with state-of-the-art appliances and Carrara marble surfaces to stunning effect.There are three bedrooms on the villa’s ground floor, all with king beds, and three on the upper story: two with double beds and one with two twin beds. All six bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms and air conditioning.The grounds and scenery around Villa Iris make it the perfect setting for a family reunion, a milestone birthday or anniversary celebration or even a destination wedding—and the honeymoon after. If you’ve just come to sightsee, it’s an easy walk through the vineyards to a nearby restaurant, where you can dine or try a wine tasting, and the towers of San Gimignano. Drive to Siena, Florence or Volterra for the day, and if you have time, continue your trip in Lucca or Pisa.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Feel the warm countryside breeze while you lounge by the pool at this renovated farmhouse in Chateaurenard. Hop in for a quick lap and then fix yourself a snack in the summer kitchen underneath the shaded pool house. Then, wander through fragrant gardens and olive groves before heading out to dinner at Table de Nicolas for traditional French cuisine, 11 kilometers away in St. Remy de Provence.Situated on 1 hectare of private, expertly manicured lawns, Mas Prestige is split between the main house, guest house, and studio. Stone walkways and lush lawns connect each separate building, adding an extra touch of privacy to the estate. Inside, stretch out on the sofa by the wood-burning fireplace, get creative in the chef’s kitchen, and pamper yourself in the spa-like ensuites.Mas Prestige comes with 5 parking spaces and 2 alfresco dining areas, so don’t be afraid to invite new friends over for dinner. Stir up a few cocktails and gather in the outdoor lounge, enjoying the countryside scenery as the sun sets. If the party goes late, fire up the charcoal grill for a late-night snack in the pool house lounge. Then, retire to the warm fire next to the master suite’s king bed.St. Remy de Provence is an incredible place to eat and drink, so work up an appetite by hiking through Alpilles Natural Regional Park. Most trails lead to scenic lookouts, so make sure to bring a camera. Then, have a light lunch at Maison Cambillau, famous for their Provencal flatbread. At dinner, Les Filles du Patissier features a new menu of fresh ingredients every day, and it’s set in a bustling square in the old town.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: After a long day skiing the Alps, retreat to the secluded hills of Megeve, at this rustic-chic ski lodge. Warm-up in the hot tub, steam room, or next to the fireplace. Stir-up a cocktail and recount tales from the day while gazing out over a view that captures the entire village leading up to soaring mountains peaks. In the morning, travel 4-kilometers to Megeve Ski Lift and do it all again.Chalet Bisons strikes guests immediately with a feeling of warmth. The traditional timber-frame construction, imposing stone features, and plush furnishings are exactly what you need after braving the Alps. Chalet Bisons tames the elements and invites its guests to do the same. The decor shows off a wide range of leathers and furs, state of the art tech features, and stainless steel appliances. The fully equipped kitchen is sure to inspire your inner chef. After you’ve eaten, gather by the fire to play a board game, watch a movie with the kids, or sneak away for a soak in the indoor hot tub.If you’re vacationing in the summertime, make sure to pack your hiking boots. The trails leading up Mont d’Arbois meander through green forests, sprawling meadows, and scenic lookouts. Once you’ve worked up an appetite, stroll along Megeve’s winding medieval streets to find the perfect place for dinner.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Find one of the best addresses in London for local character and convenience at The Citrine Suite. Tucked into this upscale historic neighbourhood just north of Piccadilly (and Buckingham Palace!), this vacation rental puts shopping and dining at your doorstep and other attractions within a short drive. Its four bedrooms are ideal for a family holiday in the city or a getaway with friends.Reach this penthouse-level suite by private elevator, then enjoy a glass of wine on the balcony or relax in front of the TV and Wi-Fi. For your comfort and convenience, the apartment has a security system, laundry facilities, and both heating and air conditioning.An elegantly panelled foyer leads from the entrance of this luxury property to a spacious open-plan living and dining room and an equally generous great room. Warm wood floors, large windows and designer furnishings make the living and dining room sunny and inviting. The great room features its own sitting area, dining area and fully equipped kitchen.The Citrine Suite has three bedrooms with king beds and one with two twin beds; all four have en-suite bathrooms. Built-in cabinets and dressing tables, neutral tones and spacious layouts give the bedrooms a polished look and a restful feel; in the bathrooms, tiles in cream and tan continue the serene vibe.If sightseeing is on your to-do list, you’ll appreciate the short walk to the Victoria & Albert Museum and Hyde Park, and the short drive to Buckingham Palace, Westminster Abbey and Big Ben. Don’t miss the chance, however, to explore the neighbourhood, where you can browse the departments of Harrods, shop for everything from gourmet deli items to designer fashions, and sit down to a family-friendly meal at a bistro or a honeymoon-worthy dinner at a Michelin-starred restaurant.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. listing.listing_description: Enjoy ski-in, ski-out access to the slopes of Verbier at Agate. This stunning vacation rental is set in a coveted location overlooking the piste and the town’s Place Blanche. Its interiors are equally enviable, with traditional details, chic furnishings and four suite-style bedrooms, and the property is available on a fully catered or self-catered basis.A fully catered holiday at Agate includes a chef at breakfast and dinner, canapés and champagne six days of the week, two days of ski instruction and around-the-clock driving service. Self-catered stays include housekeeping and a lift pass delivery service. Leave your car in one of the apartment’s two underground parking spaces and take in the views from the furnished, south-facing terrace, or treat yourself after a day on the slopes in the private spa and sauna.An open-plan great room with living and dining areas and a fully equipped kitchen offers plenty of space to relax with family and friends. The wood paneling and wood-burning fireplace create an atmosphere of warm, welcoming luxury, while floor-to-ceiling sliding doors and sleek furnishings add a modern twist.Each of the four bedrooms at Agate has an en-suite bathroom. Spend a romantic interlude in the honeymoon-worthy master bedroom, which has a king bed, fireplace and its own terrace, or sleep soundly in one of the three bedrooms with double beds.Verbier has long been a favorite in the Swiss Alps for its long runs, off-piste options and celeb-friendly après-ski scene, and Agate puts you in the center of the action. This ski-in, ski-out villa is only a 1-minute walk from the Médran lift, a 3-minute walk from shopping and dining around the town’s Place Centrale and a 5-minute drive from the Savoleyres lift.Copyright © Luxury Retreats.
